message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR 

This paper addresses a problem in computer vision related to object segmentation in video, which is a common topic in the computer vision community. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper proposes an unsupervised method for generating foreground object soft-segmentation masks based on automatic selection and learning from highly probable positive features, which involves machine learning techniques. Therefore, it is also likely to belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also mentions the use of spatio-temporal, appearance, and motion consistency, which are common techniques in multimedia analysis, suggesting that it could also belong to cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper discusses theoretical properties of the unsupervised learning method, which could also place it in the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) category.
